summary: First Edition: A novella writing website for grade 4 students with story-themed design, featuring multiple tabs (About, Writing Prompts, Image Creation, Character Development, Preview, Grammar Check, Writer's Block), word count, dark mode, save/load progress, PDF export, dictionary, thesaurus, and AI-powered writing suggestions
architectural_notes: Local storage for save/load progress (no backend required)
Story-themed UI design with child-friendly aesthetics
known_issues: Email submission not available on current plan - using local save/PDF download instead
Word count limit incorrectly enforcing 9 words instead of 2000 words
Live version still enforcing 9-word limit despite code fixes (deployment sync issue)
Saved files cannot be reopened and edited in subsequent browser sessions
After saving a file, text input flickers and word count does not increase when attempting to continue writing
Text does not persist after clicking save button
Autosave functionality is not triggering every 10 seconds as expected
Text is not saving to localStorage after clicking save button (reported as still not working)

existing_features.title: Create an About page that explains First Edition is a novella writing platform for grade 4 students, describing its features and purpose in age-appropriate language
Create a Writing Prompts page that displays creative story prompts suitable for grade 4 students to inspire their novella writing
Create an Image Creation Tool page that generates multiple illustrations based on the story text written by the student, allowing them to create visuals for their novella
Create a Character Development page that helps students build and track their story characters with fields for names, descriptions, traits, and relationships
Create a Preview page that displays the student's novella in a formatted reading view, showing text and selected images together as a complete story
Create a Grammar Check page that analyzes the student's writing and displays grammar corrections with clear explanations suitable for grade 4 comprehension
Create a Writer's Block page that provides AI-generated writing suggestions based on what the student has written so far, helping them continue their story when stuck
Implement a main writing interface with a real-time word count tracker that updates as the student types their novella
Implement dark mode toggle that allows students to switch between light and dark themes across the entire application
Implement save progress functionality that stores the student's novella text, characters, selected images, and all project data in browser local storage
Implement PDF export functionality that allows students to download their complete novella as a PDF file, including text and images in a formatted layout
Integrate dictionary functionality that allows students to look up word definitions while writing their novella
Integrate thesaurus functionality that allows students to find synonyms and alternative words while writing their novella
Design the entire website with a story-themed visual style that appeals to grade 4 children (ages 9-10), using playful, book-inspired elements, warm colors, and engaging illustrations
Reposition the thesaurus/synonyms lookup tool to display next to the dictionary tool in the writing interface sidebar, creating a horizontal layout with both tools side-by-side
Create a flipbook save feature that stores the complete novella (title, story text, and selected images) as a viewable flipbook on the website, accessible through a dedicated page or viewer component
Add a submit/save button or action that triggers the flipbook save functionality, replacing or augmenting the existing PDF export as the primary method for preserving completed novellas
Add a maximum word count limit of 2000 words to the main writing textarea on the WritingPage, preventing users from typing beyond this limit and displaying the count as 'X / 2000' format

Fix the WritingPage textarea word count validation logic to correctly enforce a 2000-word maximum limit instead of the current 9-word limit, ensuring users can type up to 2000 words before being prevented from entering more text

Fix the WritingPage textarea word count validation to correctly enforce a 2000-word maximum limit in the live production application, ensuring users can type up to 2000 words before being prevented from entering more text (currently limiting to 9 words)
Add a Google research area component to the WritingPage that allows students to search Google directly from the writing interface without leaving the page
Investigate and fix the production deployment issue causing the WritingPage textarea to enforce a 9-word limit instead of the intended 2000-word maximum limit
Add an edit button to the FlipbookPage that allows users to navigate back to the WritingPage to continue editing their saved flipbook in the same browser session
Modify the GoogleSearchTool component to display search results directly within the component instead of opening results in a new tab

Modify the ProjectContext to load saved flipbook data from localStorage into the editable project state (title, storyText, selectedImages) when the application initializes, allowing users to continue editing their saved work in the same or different browser sessions
Fix the WritingPage textarea flickering issue that occurs when users attempt to type after saving a flipbook, ensuring smooth text input without visual disruptions
Fix the word count tracker on WritingPage to correctly increment when users type additional text after saving a flipbook, ensuring real-time count updates reflect the actual word count
Investigate and resolve any state management conflicts in ProjectContext between storyText updates and flipbook save operations that may be causing the flickering and word count issues
Implement automatic saving of the story text (storyText) to localStorage every 10 seconds while the user is typing in the WritingPage textarea
Add visual feedback (e.g., small indicator or toast notification) to inform users when their story text has been automatically saved
Fix the localStorage save functionality in ProjectContext to correctly persist the storyText when the save button is clicked, ensuring the text remains stored and accessible after page reload
Fix the autosave functionality in the useAutosave hook and ProjectContext to correctly trigger every 10 seconds while the user is typing in the WritingPage textarea
Replace the AutosaveIndicator component with a progress bar that visually displays autosave progress, showing filling/loading animation during the 10-second countdown and completion state when saved
Fix the ProjectContext saveProject function to correctly persist the storyText field to localStorage under the 'project' key, ensuring the text remains stored and can be retrieved after page reload

Fix the useAutosave hook to correctly trigger the save callback every 10 seconds after the user stops typing in the WritingPage textarea, ensuring the debounce logic and timer are functioning properly

Verify the AutosaveIndicator progress bar component correctly displays the autosave countdown animation from 0% to 100% over 10 seconds, shows the saving spinner during save operation, and displays the saved checkmark after completion

Debug the integration between WritingPage, useAutosave hook, ProjectContext, and AutosaveIndicator to identify and resolve any state synchronization issues preventing autosave from triggering and progress bar from displaying
Modify the useAutosave hook to change the autosave delay from 10 seconds to 2 seconds (2000ms), ensuring the debounced save callback triggers 2 seconds after the user stops typing
Update the AutosaveIndicator component to display the text 'Saving...' during the save operation (when status is 'saving'), replacing or accompanying the current spinner visual feedback

Modify the useAutosave hook to change the autosave delay from 2 seconds to 0.5 seconds (500ms), ensuring the debounced save callback triggers 0.5 seconds after the user stops typing in the WritingPage textarea
Update the AutosaveIndicator component to adjust the progress bar animation duration to match the new 0.5 second autosave delay, ensuring the countdown animation completes in 500ms

Redesign the entire application UI from the current story-themed, child-friendly aesthetic to a clean, professional design suitable for general audiences, updating colors, typography, layout spacing, and visual elements across all pages and components
Update the CSS variables in frontend/index.css to replace the current color scheme with a professional, sophisticated palette using neutral tones, removing child-friendly warm colors
Remove or replace story-themed background images and decorative assets (such as character-card-template background) with clean, professional design elements or solid colors
Replace the current professional neutral color scheme in frontend/index.css CSS variables with a blue, red, and white color palette using OKLCH color format

Update all component styles across the application to reflect the new blue, red, and white color scheme, ensuring consistent visual theme on all pages (AboutPage, WritingPage, CharacterDevelopmentPage, PreviewPage, GrammarCheckPage, WritersBlockPage, ImageCreationPage, WritingPromptsPage, FlipbookPage)

new_feature_requests.summary: Create 5+ navigation tabs: About, Writing Prompts, Character Development, Preview, Grammar Check, Writer's Block
Image generation tool that creates multiple illustrations based on story text
Add word count tracker and dark mode toggle
Implement save/load progress functionality (local browser storage)
Add PDF export feature for completed novels
Integrate dictionary and thesaurus functionality
Writer's block suggestions based on written content
Grammar checking with visible corrections display
Story-themed design appealing to grade 4 children (ages 9-10)
Reposition thesaurus/synonyms UI next to dictionary
Save novella as flipbook on website (replace/augment PDF export)
Set maximum word count to 2000 words
Add a Google research area in the Write Your Story tab
Add edit button to allow further editing after saving a file in the same browser
Display Google research results directly on the same page within the research area
Fix saved file editability: allow adding more words after saving in same browser and enable reopening/editing saved files in any browser session
Remove or disable the logic in WritingPage that prevents editing after a flipbook has been saved, ensuring the textarea remains editable regardless of flipbook save state
Implement autosave functionality that saves entered text to localStorage every 10 seconds while typing
Reduce autosave interval from 10 seconds to 2 seconds
Display 'Saving...' message during autosave operation
Reduce autosave interval from 2 seconds to 0.5 seconds
Redesign the webpage UI to a more professional aesthetic (moving away from story-themed/child-friendly design)
Apply calligraphic fonts and update color scheme to blue, red, and white
Update the global CSS typography in frontend/index.css to use calligraphic or script-style fonts for headings and decorative text elements throughout the application
